  • Direct Known Subclasses:

extends java.lang.Object

    • Method Detail

      • syncPosition

        public void syncPosition(int x,
                         int y)
        Checks a given index in the grid and ensures that the geometry of the GridElement is set to the array index. Animations will be played if movement is required

      • syncPositions

        public void syncPositions()
        Checks each index in the grid and ensures that the geometry of the GridElement is set to the array index. Animations will be played if movement is required

      • getElement

        public GridElement getElement(IntVector pos)
        Gets the grid element in a given index. Returns null if pos is null or out of bounds.
        Parameters:
        pos -
        Returns:
        the element from the index

      • getElement

        public GridElement getElement(int x,
                              int y)
        Gets the grid element in a given index. Returns null of coordinates are out of bounds.
        Parameters:
        x - x index component
        y - y index component
        Returns:
        the element from the index

      • markForDelete

        public boolean markForDelete(int x,
                             int y)
        destroys a GridElement in a given index and sets the index to null returns true if something was destroyed
        Parameters:
        x - horizontal component of position to destroy
        y - vertical component of position to destroy

      • moveElement

        public boolean moveElement(boolean animate,
                           IntVector currentPosition,
                           IntVector newPosition)
        Move an element from one position to another position. If either the currentPosition or newPosition are null or out of bounds, the command is ignored if the currentPosition does not contain an element, the command is ignored.
        Parameters:
        currentPosition - current position
        newPosition - new position
        Returns:
        true if move was successful

      • withinBounds

        public boolean withinBounds(IntVector pos)
        Check if a given index is within bounds. An error message is printed to console if out of grid bounds
        Parameters:
        pos - index to check
        Returns:
        true if within bounds

      • withinBounds

        public boolean withinBounds(int x,
                            int y)
        Check if a given index is within bounds. An error message is printed to console if out of grid bounds
        Parameters:
        x - x index component
        y - y index component
        Returns:
        true if within bounds

      • markForDelete

        public void markForDelete(java.util.ArrayList<IntVector> indexes)
        marks GridElements for deletion based on a list of indexes
        Parameters:
        indexes - list of indexes to mark for delete

      • markForDelete

        public void markForDelete(IntVector index)
        Marks the element in a given index for deletion at the end of the update loop. This is used because sometimes we need to maintain the reference of the element in the grid so we cannot immediately delete it.
        Parameters:
        index -

      • deleteAllMarked

        public void deleteAllMarked()
        Deletes all GridElements that are marked for deletion

      • getRandomElementIndex

        public IntVector getRandomElementIndex()
        returns a random index where the element is not null or marked for deletion
        Returns:
        an IntVector with the grid location of a random element or null if the grid is empty

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        returns true if its empty
        Returns:
        true if empty

      • count

        public int count()
        returns number of elements in grid
        Returns:
        number of elements

      • getFurthestColumn

        public int getFurthestColumn()
        Gets the right-most column that is not empty
        Returns:
        column index of the right-most column that is not empty

      • getNearestElement

        public IntVector getNearestElement(IntVector pos)
        Gets the nearest non-null index from a given starting 2D array index. This excludes the original starting index
        Parameters:
        pos - index to start search
        Returns:
        nearest non-null index in the grid (excluding original position), or null if pos is null or out of bounds

      • clear

        public void clear()
        removes all elements from the grid.
